argument.name: shape_name
argument.description: The name of the shape to draw on the bitmap. The Shape_Name is defined by one of the following functions: UI_SHAPE_OVAL(), UI_SHAPE_START_POLY(), UI_SHAPE_RECT(), and UI_SHAPE_ROUND_RECT().

argument.name: XPos
argument.description: The horizontal coordinate of the upper left corner of the shape. Larger values move right.

argument.name: YPos
argument.description: The vertical coordinate of the upper left corner of the shape. Larger values move down.

page.discussion: The SHAPE() function draws the named shape onto the bitmap. The border color is set by the current pen. There is no fill. Compare to the FILL_SHAPE()and INNER_SHAPE()functions. Limitations: Used only in the Code sections of UI_BITMAP_DRAW(), UI_SCREEN_DRAW(), and UI_PRINTER_DRAW().

section.title: Example
section.description: This example creates an oval shape and draws it onto the bitmap.

section.example: ui_bitmap_create("test", 4, 2) ui_shape_oval("oval", .25, .25, 2, 1) ui_bitmap_draw("test", <<%code% inner_rect(0, 0, 4, 2) set_pen("black") set_brush("green") shape("oval", 0, 0) %code%) ui_dlg_box("", "{image=test}")
